These plants are typically herbaceous and can be found in wet or moist environments such as marshes and along stream banks. Airella species often have soft, fuzzy leaves and produce showy, pink or white flowers. They are characterized by their ability to thrive in waterlogged soils and their fibrous, mucilaginous stems. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
